enrl_requirement: Enrollment Requirements: Pre-req: Students must have passed Korean 211-3 or  be placed in according to department placement.
title: WCAS KOREAN 311-2-20 Korean IV - Korean through Movies: Contemporary Cultures in the Media

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This advanced Korean language course is designed to challenge students to further develop their language proficiency through movies. Students will work on to improve their linguistic ability in both spoken and written discourse and to enhance their knowledge in Korean history, culture and society through the authentic Korean films.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: Completion of 211-3 or the departmental placement

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: Students will be watching authentic Korean movies; describing and narrating the topic, plot, and details of films verbally; interpreting the cultural and historical context of films; writing interpretive and analytical essays

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Grades will be given based on attendance and class participation, vocabulary quizzes, discussion papers, reflection papers, oral presentations, and final project.

subject: KOREAN
